quote: Civilization depends on morality.
Aim above morality. Be not simply good, be good for something.
Art, like morality, consists in drawing the line somewhere.
Conventionality is not morality. Self-righteousness is not religion. To attack the first is not to assail the last.
Democracy without morality is impossible.

Art, like morality, consists in drawing the line somewhere.
Conventionality is not morality. Self-righteousness is not religion. To attack the first is not to assail the last.

Each man must grant himself the emotions that he needs and the morality that suits him.
Every man, in his own opinion, forms an exception to the ordinary rules of morality.
Fear is the mother of morality.
Gossip is charming! History is merely gossip. But scandal is gossip made tedious by morality.
He was as great as a man can be without morality.
Honor is simply the morality of superior men.

Morality and expediency coincide more than the cynics allow.

Morality consists in suspecting other people of not being legally married.
Morality is a private and costly luxury.

Morality is not the doctrine of how we may make ourselves happy, but how we may make ourselves worthy of happiness.
Morality is of the highest importance - but for us, not for God.
Morality is simply the attitude we adopt towards people we personally dislike.

Morality is the attitude we adopt toward people whom we personally dislike.
Morality is the basis of things and truth is the substance of all morality.
Morality is the herd-instinct in the individual.
Morality is the theory that every human act must be either right or wrong, and that 99 % of them are wrong.

Morality sticks faster when presented in brief sayings than when presented in long discourse.
